Ôº±: I'm young and have good eyes. I don't need this.
Ôº°: Young teens may be twice as sensitive to light at night, and the elderly much less so. These results have important implications for schools, senior care, and device usage at night, too. Simply put: everyone has a use for this and will notice benefits from decreased blue light.

Ôº±: Why not G.lux or Night Light?
Ôº°: Other extensions like G.Lux or Night Light just change your display's color. Screen Shader is the only extension available that smartly changes the color of your screen throughout the day using sunset/sunrise times! Research has proven that the circadian rhythm is tied to solar time. Individuals have shown greater preference for screen tinting applications that take that into account.

Ôº±: Does this really remove blue light from my display?
Ôº°: Yup! Screens work by individually tweaking the amount of red, green, and blue each pixel of your emits.  Pixels being the small square of colors that together form the image. Screen Shader alters the coloration of websites to a redder color.  To show these colors, the display will tweak its pixels to show more red light, less green light, and considerably less blue light; but just enough so you can still see different colors.  The more you increase the shade, the more the color of the website will be reddened, the less your computer display will emit blue light!

Ôº±: Why do I need this?  Can‚Äôt I simply change my screen's brightness?
Ôº°: Changing the luminosity does not remove white and blue light from your display. Those colors are still unnatural and will irritate your eyes, even if dimmed. A full day in front of your computer can wreak havoc upon your melatonin cycle and internal clock. The unnatural light can also harm your eye retina.  Screen Shader is designed to considerably reduce these effects by eliminating enough white and blue light to provide you with the best browsing experience and eye comfort.
